DataElement.preferredName: Associated Persons Adverse Events Domain Adverse Event Relationship Immunotherapy Relationship Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response to classify the relationship of adverse event to immunotherapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Adverse Event Domain Adverse Event Relationship Immunotherapy
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to an adverse event.:Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s)._A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something._Therapy designed to induce changes in a patient's immune status in order to treat disease.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to an adverse event.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s)._A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Replaced No Value Exists with concept definition. mc 5.15.19

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not connected or associated e.g. by kinship.

Concepts.definition: Not connected or associated e.g. by kinship.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having little chance of being the case or of coming about.

Concepts.definition: Having little chance of being the case or of coming about.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A measure of the expectation of the occurrence of a particular event.

Concepts.definition: A measure of the expectation of the occurrence of a particular event.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of very strong agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of very strong agreement.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.:Related; connected or associated.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).
A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
